ratings.comment: Prof Mullins is clearly passionate and knowledgable. She recognizes that students aren't math majors so only teaches what she thinks you actually need. Expect weekly quizzes, assignments, and in-class activities with four tests. Do the work and pay attention in class and you can definitely get the A. Also, one notecard is allowed per test.

Really nice professor. She takes the time to remember your names in a large lecture. Tests straight forward. Easy project at the end. Lot's of homework, but you'll survive. Nothing is graded too harshly

In class exercises, 4 exams, iclicker, weekly homework due before you learn the chapter, a lot of work but a passionate teacher. Makes a big deal out of name cards for some reason and loves sound effects in her powerpoints. She has a booklet with all the slides in it, which is incredibly helpful and nice. She is a great professor, just lots of work

Prof Mullins is clearly experienced and she knows the best way to teach the course. As someone who didn't take Stats in high school, the material was challenging at times. The class was dull, hard and time consuming but Mullins was a solid professor. If you put the required effort (5-6 hrs per week) in, you will get an A or B.

I really liked her.  She loves the subject she's teaching and she genuinely wants her students to do well.  She also tries to make a very boring subject somewhat fun in class.  Lectures are long, however, and can be rough to sit through.

Lectures are painfully boring and filled with disrespectful b. school students. If I could go back and do it over, I would take this online. Prof. Mullins goes out of her way to make this class and these topics moderately entertaining for her students (90% bros), and it just comes off as unhelpful and painfully annoying. TA was also subpar.
Awesome! loved class

She is a horrible professor. Do not take this class online she takes forever to cover simple concepts and over complicates them. I missed the final exam hence the horrible final grade so I emailed her pleading for any chance to gain any points on it and she did not even take the time to email me back. DO NOT TAKE HER. Extremely unreasonable.

Patty is an excellent teacher. She enjoys what she's teaching and tries to get the students to like it, or at least understand it, even if that is through her use of obnoxious sound effects. The book is only helpful for homework assignments. The tests are more conceptual than calculations, so be sure to pay attention in class and take good notes.

She is a good teacher, but is super annoying. Be ready to hear her say "name cards? where are your name cards?" at least once a lecture. Exams are MC but she gives in class exercises that are harshly graded

Patricia is a really nice lady, however, this was her first semester teaching GB 304 and it was a train wreck. Homeworks and discussions had nothing to do with exams and lecture was more or less useless. I would recommend taking this class with another professor if possible

Highly recommend online over the in-class section. Open note quizzes & multiple choice hw with 2 tries. Online lectures were extremely clear, and it was nice to be able to watch lecture multiple times to review. Fun game: count how many times she yells "don't turn over the exams" before exams. Usually at least 12-13 times.

Professor Mullins is a great professor and really nice, but this class is just all around a tough and dry class, especially the online class, which I took. Exams were not what I would expect, a lot less calculation of stats, and more concept-based.
WORST ONLINE CLASS EVER. SERIOUSLY HOMEWORK NEED TO BE SEND AFTER EACH EXAM?

She is a wonderful professor that genuinely cares about her students. I went in for office hours and she was more than willing to help me understand the material. I was able to get a 100% on the second exam and have never taken stats before so she must be doing something right. I highly recommend taking this class with her.
isn't specific about what is on the test and the material is incredibly dry and boring. try to focus and you will do well

Mullins is as good as it gets for stats. Her power points are straight forward and clear (despite annoying sound effects) and her exams are as easy as it gets for math. The one difficulty is that the class has not curve, so what you get is what you get grade wise. If you stay on top of things and study just a little bit you will do fine.

Tests have nothing to do with homework, quizzes, anything really. Tests are pretty easy, you get a notecard and are allowed to use a graphing calculator. Really strict about late homework, missing anything you get a 0 no excuses. But overall is fair and if you try in the class you wont get lower than a B.

I took the online portion of this class. It has been a challenge, but not because of Prof. Mullins! She is great at explaining the material. Exams aren't too terrible, it's just stats is a different realm for some people. I have no complaints here.

She was very clear and went through and carefully explained her examples (however, some of this may have been better than sitting in lecture because her online lectures were edited). Online course is highly recommended. exams weren't too difficult, neither are class activities if you've read the chapter.

Professor Mullins was great. On the harder chapters she spent a few days of class to explain everything in depth.  Mullins is very transparent about what will be on the exams, and you even get a note card.  The only bad thing about Mullins is that she uses clip art way too much.

Worst professor I've had at Madison.  Her lectures and homework have nothing to do with the exam questions.  We only got a notecard for the exams while most other stats classes got 3 pieces of paper...avoid this class!!
Shes a super nice lady,great personality. Takes a boring subject and makes it pretty interesting. There are no surprises in the class and its not that hard.
I had her couple years ago and I must agree with the previous comments. I didnt like her at all.
No, Just No. She's just a bad teacher, takes something easy and makes it hard.

Avoid her. She will give you a good grade if only if you kiss up. Whatever you do, DO NOT TAKE THE ONLINE SECTION. She will always surprise you with an email saying that there are hw due tomorrow (she did it in the 1st day of class!!)

Important you go to class every day because she uses clickers for attendance and at least one in class activity per chapter which is turned in for a grade.  No curve so you won't get screwed if there are a lot of smart people in the class.  You get to use a notecard for every test which helps a lot.  Incredibly boring lecture.

I really like her.  Class was time consuming with homework, quizzes, and exams, but it all helps you learn the material.  She's super nice and office hours are helpful.  If you have to take stats she's the way to go.

Mullins is awesome. Makes the class fun and interesting. Noncumulative tests are fairly easy (but get harder as the semester progresses). Let's you use a notecard. In class exercises are pretty important so don't blow them off. Doesn't curve. Is fairly helpful. She's big on class participation so go to lecture as much as possible.

Awesome professor, honestly tries to make class fun (its stats, give her a little break).  Book is used solely for homework.  There are a lot of assignments, in class exercises, and quizzes...however the class is not curved so I got horrible grades on the exams and still did well in the class.  Overall I would recommend taking Stats with Mullins.

Explains everything very clearly. Must study for tests (maybe for two or three hours), but they are very straightforward. No curve, which makes things difficult when test averages are Cs. Hated discussion.
She's wonderful and very clear with her explanations. The text book is only needed for homework

Mullins is the best professor I have had at UW. She explains things clearly, her powerpoints are amazing, and she is just one of the nicest professors i've had. the class has a lot of hw, quiz almost every week, so its a class you cant be lazy about. all together, if you have to take a stats class, take it with mullins.

P. Mullins is a good professor but I didn't enjoy the class. There are 4 exams including the final, lots of homework, lots of quizzes in discussion, and in-class exercises which make going to class mandatory. In a way it was good to have all of the other stuff because I got a B on every exam but still got an A in the class.

Professor Mullins is a great teacher.  Lectures are presented on slides and are organized well. Homework is due before she lectures on the material.  Gives in-class exercises to make sure you attend lecture. Exams are not bad.  Get help with the Business Learning Center early on.  It helps with learning the material.

Great professor and an extremely easy class. I'm not sure why everyone says the in-class exercises sucked - they were easy points. Exams were straightforward and the quizzes were fair. I never studied for an exam (except to make my notecard!) and got an A. I'd definitely recommend her & the class.

She's very helpful and pleasant in class if you can get past the hopelessly boring material and backwards order of doing homework before learning the material. The work load isn't bad and it's well balanced. Also, you actually have to go to discussion because there are weekly quizzes. I would take another class with her if it wasn't a stats class.
She does a great job...the in class exercises suck, I think the class is really easy as long as you stay on top of the material.

The class starts off rather easily, reviewing basic probability material. However, the homework policy (must be handed in before class starts), the in class exercises, and the quizzes are things that make this class less appealing. Exams are way too close together. I've had 3 exams in this class and only 1 or 2 in each of my others
No Comments

treats us like we're twelve. makes you bring nametags to every lecture. cold calls on people. has the homework due before she lectures on the topic, which just wastes time. still not a super hard class though.
Very good professor.  She tried really hard to make the class interesting and fun.  Quizzes and homework help your grade a decent amount.

Nice lady, but doesn't help explain the points all too well in lecture. To really get clarity, you need to go to office hours. She does give a notecard, but this is nothing compared to other stats classes. The others are much much easier and I would advise taking another class for your stats requirement.

very nice woman, very helpful, tries to help you out as much as possible, work load sucks as there is homework and quizzes once a week if not more, tests are very straightforward and easy especially with a notecard

Easy to get at least a B. Tests are pretty straight forward, she lets you use a notecard with formulas, etc. Very enthusiastic teacher, good examples. Work load isn't bad (weekly HW and quizzes)--just enough to have grades based on more than tests.
